full_summary:
### Advance Procurement Notice - Design-Builder Services for the Armoured Combat Support Vehicle Project

#### Overview

A request for quotation (RFQ) is anticipated to be issued by Defence Construction Canada for the provision of Design-Builder services for the Armoured Combat Support Vehicle Project (ACSV Project). The project involves the design and construction of a facility for the maintenance and storage of ACSV vehicles at the 5th Canadian Division Support Base (CDSB) Gagetown, New Brunswick (NB).

#### Project Description and Requirements

The ACSV Project is a key initiative for the Canadian Armed Forces to deliver new armored combat support vehicles. The project will require the design and construction of a facility with an estimated total project value of $26,800,000. The Design-Builder will be responsible for the concept development, design, and construction of the facility, as well as associated ancillary site works and utilities.

#### Security Clearance Requirements

To be eligible for contract award, Design-Builder firms will be required to hold a valid and active Designated Organization Screening (DOS) granted or approved by the Contract Security Program (CSP), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC). Defence Construction Canada will provide sponsorship under its Industrial Security Program (ISP) to facilitate the security clearance application process for Design-Builder firms.

#### Procurement Timeline

It is anticipated that the RFQ will be issued in the spring of 2024, pending approval to proceed from the Department of National Defence. Design-Builder firms are advised to begin the security clearance application process immediately to ensure timely completion of the sponsorship request package.

#### Contact Information

For further information, please contact Yuriy Klitynskyy, Team Leader, Contract Services, Defence Construction Canada, at (506) 471-3972 or yuriy.klitynskyy@dcc-cdc.gc.ca.

#### Disclaimer

Defence Construction Canada does not provide any assurances or guarantees that a sponsorship request package or a security clearance application will be successful or result in the granting of the requested security clearance. Design-Builder firms accept and agree to bear any risks associated with the completeness or accuracy of their application and related documents, as well as the timeliness of any processing or granting of security clearance.
